plan:
Plan:
1. Start by bidding 50% of the value as suggested by economists to establish a baseline.
2. Gradually increase the percentage to see if it leads to more wins without significantly reducing profits.
3. Test bidding a flat rate, regardless of value, to see if consistency outperforms variability.
4. Experiment with bidding aggressively at a high percentage of value to gather data on the risk-reward balance.

1. Start with the dominant strategy of bidding 50% of my value for the first 5 rounds to establish a baseline.
2. For rounds 6-10, experiment with aggressive bidding, placing bids slightly above 50% of my value.
3. For rounds 11-15, try conservative bidding, placing bids slightly below 50% of my value.
4. Analyze the results after each round, adjusting bids based on competitor behavior.
5. If consistently losing, consider more aggressive strategies.
6. If consistently winning with small profits, consider more conservative strategies.

1. Initial Rounds (1-3): Bid 50% of my value as suggested by economists. Analyze the bidding patterns of Andy and Betty.
2. Mid Rounds (4-9): Test aggressive strategy. If my value is high (>70), bid more than 50% value. If low (<30), bid less than 50%. Monitor outcomes.
3. Later Rounds (10-12): Test conservative strategy. Bid exactly 50% value regardless of my value. Compare results with aggressive strategy.

Plan: Continue to bid 50% of value. Experiment by increasing bid amount slightly above 50%, around 55-60% of value. Observe if this leads to more wins. Also, consider bidding a fixed amount if previous strategy doesn't work.

Increase bid to 60% of my value for the next 5 rounds. Analyze competitors' bids to adjust my strategy. If consistently losing, bid aggressively at 70%. If winning with small profits, revert to 50% bid strategy.
Continue bidding 50% of value for rounds 1-3. In rounds 4-9, bid aggressively, over 50% if value >70, under 50% if value <30. In rounds 10-12, revert to 50% bid. Monitor outcomes.
Plan: Increase bid to 60% of value to explore winning chances. If unsuccessful, test fixed amount strategy, bidding a consistent $40. Monitor outcomes to determine best long-term strategy.

Continue with the dominant strategy of bidding 50% for the next 3 rounds. Analyze competitors' bids and adjust strategy accordingly. If consistently losing, increase bid to 60%. If winning with small profits, consider a more conservative approach by bidding slightly less than 50%.

For rounds 2-3, maintain 50% bid strategy. For rounds 4-9, adopt aggressive strategy - bid 60% if value >70, 40% if value <30. For rounds 10-12, revert to 50% bid. Analyze outcomes and adjust strategies accordingly.

Plan: Increase bid to 65% of value to enhance winning chances. If unsuccessful, adopt fixed bid strategy, bidding a consistent $50. Also, try a low-risk strategy by bidding slightly above the second-highest bid from previous rounds. Monitor outcomes to optimize long-term strategy.
Continue with 50% bid for next 2 rounds. If consistently winning, decrease bid to 40% for data gathering. If losing, increase bid to 60%. Adjust strategy based on competitors' bids and profit margin.
For rounds 3-5, bid 50% of value. From round 6-9, adopt an aggressive approach - if value >70, bid 60%, if <30, bid 40%. For rounds 10-12, revert to 50% bid. Adjust strategy based on outcomes.

Plan: Continue bidding 65% of value. Analyze the second highest bids from previous rounds and try bidding slightly above them. If unsuccessful, test fixed bid strategy, bidding a consistent $50. Monitor outcomes to refine strategy.

Continue with a 50% bid for the next round. If losing, increase bid to 60% for the following 3 rounds. If consistently winning with small profits, test a conservative 40% bid strategy. Always adjust strategy based on competitors' bids and profit trends.
For rounds 4-7, bid 60% if value >70, 40% if value <30. For rounds 8-9, test bidding 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. Rounds 10-12, revert to 50% bid. Analyze results.

Plan: Maintain bidding 65% of value. Observe second highest bid from previous rounds, and experiment by bidding slightly above it. If unsuccessful, test fixed bid strategy, bidding a consistent $55. Analyze outcomes to optimize strategy.

Continue with a 50% bid for next round. If losing, increase bid to 60% for next 3 rounds. If winning with small profits, test a conservative 40% bid. Adjust strategy based on competitors' bids and profit trends.

For rounds 5-7, continue aggressive strategy: bid 60% if value >70, 40% if value <30. In rounds 8-9, test bidding 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. Rounds 10-12, revert to 50% bid. Analyze results and adjust accordingly.

Plan: Continue with 65% of value bid. Additionally, bid $1 more than the second highest bid from the previous round. If unsuccessful, test fixed bid strategy, bidding a consistent $60. Adjust strategy based on outcomes.

For rounds 6-8, I'll test aggressive bidding by bidding 60% of my value. If I'm consistently losing, I'll increase to 70% for rounds 9-10. For rounds 11-13, I'll revert to conservative bidding at 40%, then evaluate for the final two rounds.

For rounds 6-8, maintain aggressive strategy: bid 60% if value >70, 40% if value <30. In rounds 9-10, experiment: bid 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. Rounds 11-12, revert to 50% bid. Adjust strategy based on outcomes.

Plan: Continue bidding 65% of value. Experiment with bidding $1 more than previous round's second highest bid. If unsuccessful, test a fixed bid strategy, bidding consistently $60. Adjust based on outcomes.

For rounds 7-9, I'll bid 60% of my value. If losing, I'll bid 70% in round 10. For rounds 11-13, I'll bid 40% of my value. For the final rounds, I'll adjust based on competitor behavior and profit trends.

For rounds 7-9, increase aggression: bid 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. For round 10, revert to 50% bid. In rounds 11-12, test conservative strategy: bid 40% if value >60, 20% if value <40. Evaluate profits and adjust.

Plan: Continue bidding 65% of value. Experiment with bidding $1 more than previous round's second highest bid. If unsuccessful, test a fixed bid strategy, bidding consistently $60. Adjust based on outcomes. Analyze competitors' bids to predict their strategy and optimize profit.

For rounds 8-10, I'll bid 70% of my value to test aggressive bidding. If losing, I'll adjust to 80% in round 11. For rounds 12-14, I'll revert to conservative bidding at 40%. I'll adjust my final bid based on competitor behavior and profit trends.

For rounds 8-9, bid 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. In round 10, revert to 50% bid. In rounds 11-12, test conservative strategy: bid 40% if value >60, 20% if value <40. Adjust strategy based on results.

Plan: Continue bidding 65% of value. Experiment with bidding $1 more than previous round's second highest bid. If unsuccessful, test a fixed bid strategy, bidding consistently $65. Analyze competitors' bids to predict their strategy and optimize profit. Consider bidding closer to value in future rounds.

For rounds 9-11, I'll bid 70% of my value to increase my chances of winning. For rounds 12-14, I'll revert to conservative bidding at 40%. In the final round, I'll adjust my bid based on competitor behavior and profit trends.

For rounds 9-10, maintain aggressive strategy: bid 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. In rounds 11-12, test conservative strategy: bid 40% if value >60, 20% if value <40. Adjust strategy based on results.

Plan: Maintain bidding 65% of value. Experiment with a slight increase, bidding $2 more than previous round's second highest bid. If unsuccessful, test a fixed bid strategy, bidding consistently $65. Analyze competitors' bids to predict their strategy and optimize profit. Consider bidding closer to value in future rounds.
For rounds 10-12, I will bid 70% of my value. If consistently losing, I'll increase to 80% for round 13. For final rounds, I'll adjust my bid based on competitors' behavior and profit trends.

For rounds 10-12, revert to 50% bid strategy for data comparison. From round 13, bid aggressively, 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. Last two rounds, bid conservatively, 40% if value >60, 20% if value <40. Adjust based on outcomes.

Plan: Continue bidding 65% of value and raise bid $2 above previous second highest bid. If unsuccessful, test fixed bid of $70. Analyze competitors' bids to predict strategy and optimize profit. Consider bidding closer to value in future rounds.

For rounds 11-13, I'll revert to conservative bidding by bidding 40% of my value. If consistently losing, I'll increase to 50% for round 14. For the final round, I'll adjust my bid based on competitors' behavior and profit trends.

For rounds 11-12, continue with 50% bid. From round 13, bid aggressively, 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. Final rounds, bid conservatively, 40% if value >60, 20% if value <40. Adjust based on results.

Plan: Continue bidding 65% of value. Experiment with bidding $1 less than my last successful bid. If unsuccessful, test a fixed bid strategy, bidding consistently $70. Analyze competitors' bids to predict their strategy and optimize profit. Consider bidding closer to value in future rounds.
For rounds 12-14, I will bid 60% of my value. If consistently losing, I'll increase to 70% for the final round. I'll adjust my bid based on competitors' behavior and profit trends.
For rounds 12-13, continue with 50% bid strategy. From round 14, bid aggressively, 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. Final round, bid conservatively, 40% if value >60, 20% if value <40.

Plan: Continue bidding 65% of value. Experiment with bidding $3 more than previous round's second highest bid. If unsuccessful, test a fixed bid strategy, bidding consistently $75. Analyze competitors' bids to predict their strategy and optimize profit. Consider bidding closer to value in future rounds.

For rounds 13-14, I'll bid 60% of my value. If losing, I'll increase to 70% for the final round. I'll adjust my bid based on competitors' behavior and profit trends. I'll also consider bidding slightly lower if I'm consistently winning to increase profit.
For round 13, adopt aggressive strategy: bid 70% if value >80, 30% if value <20. For final round 14, switch to conservative strategy: bid 40% if value >60, 20% if value <40. Adjust based on outcomes.

Plan: Continue bidding 65% of value. Experiment with aggressive strategy, bidding 75% of value. If unsuccessful, test fixed bid strategy, bidding consistently $80. Analyze competitors' bids to predict their strategy and optimize profit. Consider bidding closer to value in final rounds.

For the final round, I'll bid aggressively at 70% of my value. If consistently winning, I'll consider a more conservative strategy to maximize profit. I will adjust my bid based on competitors' behavior and profit trends.

For the final round, adopt a conservative strategy: bid 40% if value >60, 20% if value <40. Evaluate the results and refine the strategy for future games, factoring in the behavior of other bidders and the value distribution.
